entry.title: New release for Chartbrew: v3.11.0
entry.content:
Changelog

âœ¨ New features

  • Added a conversation-like experience for generating and adjusting SQL queries, enhancing usability in building custom queries.
  • Introduced "Ask AI" functionality to help users generate SQL queries based on natural language prompts.
  • The CB_OPENAI_API_KEY and CB_OPENAI_MODEL env variables are now available and will be required for AI features if you are self-hosting Chartbrew - Full variable list

ğŸš€ Feature changes

  • Pre-selected the data source in the dataset builder for a smoother experience.
  • Improved the date picker in dataset filters to use the time granularity of the chart.
  • Filters now account for the chart's time interval when filtering by dates.

ğŸ› Bug fixes

  • Fixed crash issues with numeric values in exposed chart filters.
  • Resolved group-by issues in the visual SQL builder.
  • Fixed crashes in the public dashboard page.
  • Fixed issues with the wrong token being sent to the API for email changes.
  • Fixed visual query not displaying correctly when starting a new query.
  • Resolved issues with chart date settings checkboxes and date comparison in the data filter module.
  • Fixed filter variables when used through search parameters.
  • Fixed the "wrong active team" issue when browsing another team's projects.

ğŸ”’ Security updates

  • Added rate limits for the "Ask AI" route to prevent abuse.

Other changes

  • ğŸ“ Updated copy for the AI feature text and query run button labels for better clarity.
  • ğŸš§ Removed unnecessary dividers in the UI.
  • ğŸ”§ Updated environment variables in the template file for better configuration management.

entry.title: New release for Chartbrew: v3.12.0
entry.content:
Changelog

âœ¨ New features

  • Added gauge charts, providing a new way to visualize data.
  • Introduced markdown widget support for dashboards, allowing for rich-text content display.
  • Added table view for MongoDB query results for better readability.
  • Added the ability to duplicate datasets and duplicate connections, making it easier to reuse configurations.

ğŸš€ Feature changes

  • Improved dashboard layout editing by requiring confirmation before saving changes.
  • Redesigned the suspense loader to better match the brand.
  • Added a team switcher in the team settings screen.
  • Added support for CTRL key to toggle the layout editor.

ğŸ› Bug fixes

  • Fixed issue where weekdays were not compatible with Luxon (#272).
  • Fixed crash when searching for variables in public dashboards.
  • Fixed hovering issues on bar charts.
  • Fixed URL-based pagination issues in API connections.
  • Fixed nested object crashes when viewing MongoDB query results in a table format (#268).
  • Fixed automatic team selection when switching between teams.

ğŸš€ UI/UX improvements

  • Improved hover targeting on horizontal charts.
  • Added fully custom chart tooltips with an improved design.
  • Improved UI for API connection forms.

ğŸ”€ Merged community contributions

  • Restored timezone support in updateSchedule (#273) (Thanks, @MinSomai!)

â¬†ï¸ Dependency updates

  • Updated client and server dependencies for performance and security improvements.

New Contributors

  • @MinSomai made their first contribution in https://github.com/chartbrew/chartbrew/pull/275

entry.title: New release for Chartbrew: v3.13.0
entry.content:
Changelog

âœ¨ New features

  • Introduced a layout editor that allows editing all breakpoints simultaneously, making it easier to manage responsive designs.
  • Added ClickHouse support, using the official Node.js SDK and a query assistant for guided queries.
  • Added an AI query assistant for MongoDB datasets, enabling easier querying via AI.
  • Added SSH tunnel support for all PostgreSQL and MySQL-based connections, enhancing security for remote connections.

ğŸš€ Feature changes

  • Segment-type charts now have colors assigned by default, improving visual clarity.
  • Redesigned data labels for segment charts to match the gauge chart's look.
  • Introduced the option to dash the last point in line charts, providing more visual differentiation in time series data.
  • Improved the design of the table dataset switch, and hid it if only one dataset is available.

ğŸ› Bug fixes

  • Fixed dataset selection issues in tables (#283) by selecting datasets by index rather than legend.
  • Fixed chart rendering crashes caused by data labels.
  • Fixed hover issues on bar charts.
  • Fixed PostgreSQL connection details not populating correctly when editing.
  • Fixed crashes caused by null values in charts and tables.
  • Fixed chart rendering issues when dataItems had missing labels.

ğŸ”’ Security updates

  • Added a module to encrypt certificate files, improving security for stored credentials.

Other changes

  • ğŸ“ Updated Chartbrew logo banner for a refreshed look.
  • ğŸ“ Added a ClickHouse tutorial in the connection form.
  • ğŸ“ Updated CONTRIBUTING.md and added a CLA (Contributor License Agreement).
  • ğŸ”§ Added a CLA assistant workflow for managing contributions.
  • ğŸš¨ Fixed linter errors across the codebase.
  • â¬†ï¸ Updated minor versions of server and client dependencies.
